column4: If I'm not mistaken samba uses the usernames and passwords from the host computer to authenticate
but why would my laptop sometimes ask for a password, but on my gf's it never asks?  i've even tried "saving" it on my laptop, no luck.
You should be able to check something like "remember this password" on the client machines. This is probably why some of the computers being asked for credentials
hmm check your samba settings system --> administration--> samba. Then go to preferences --> server settings
ah.  it's a server.  i have webmin to configure samba, or the conf file :D
are you allowing a guest account? what is the authentication mode?
yes i believe i have the guest account enabled.
that could be why it prompts sometimes and other times doesn't. Try turning that off and it should prompt all the time.
lol what if i never want it to prompt... i'd prefer no password authentication.  i know, not secure... but it's only on my lan.
Not really sure, I haven't dug into samba that far, but My guess would be to try domain.
As long as all of your computers are on the same domain, it should authenticate
hrm.  is that supported in samba v3?  i know they're making a lot of big promises for v4... but last i tried it wasn't nearly production-ready.
don't know about the webmin interface, but it sure is an option on my box. 10.04
do you know what version of samba you're running?  if you didn't do any mucking with your repo's i'd assume v3...
hrm.  alrighty, i'll pokie around.  thanks!
